abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
Learn about important changes to Core Location.
Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that exports assets in a format that you specify using an export preset.
Exports the asset to the output location in the specified file type.
Monitors the progress state of an export operation.
The dynamic range policy to use when generating images.
An object that mediates resource requests from a URL asset.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to enable attaching Common Media Client Data as HTTP request headers.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the capture device performs automatic video frame rate adjustments.
A class property that indicates whether a person enables the Background Replacement feature for this app.
The abstract superclass for capture outputs that can record captured data to a file.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the photo output configures the render pipeline to perform constant color capture.
A Boolean value that Indicates whether the capture session configures the app’s audio session to mix with others.
A mode that stabilizes video using the enhanced extended cinematic stabilization algorithm.
An asynchronous stream of metric information.
An object that models the timeline and playback sequence of a primary player item and scheduled interstitial events.
A player item output that vends media with a legible characteristic as rendered pixel buffers.
An asset that represents media at a local or remote URL.
The properties of the media extension format reader that decodes the asset.
Capture content with your app’s camera experience when the device is locked.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
